volume.title: The Manager's Path: A Guide for Tech Leaders Navigating Growth and Change

highlights.content: A great manager will notice some of the little things youâ€™re doing well in your day-to-day, and recognize you for them. Keep track of this feedback, good and bad, and use it when you write your self-review for the year.
Good managers know that delivering feedback quickly is more valuable than waiting for a convenient time to say something.
Asking your manager for advice is also a good way to show that you respect her. People like to feel helpful, and managers are not immune to this sort of flattery.
